biz.aduna.map.cluster
Interface IconFactory

public interface IconFactory

An IconFactory is used by a ClusterMap to retrieve Images that it will use to represent certain objects in the visualisation.

A selection level is also specified that indicated whether the object is selected or not. Currently, only 0f (not selected) and 1f (selected) are used. In the future, values inbetween may also be used.

All Images returned by this interface should be fully loaded in memory, e.g. by using BufferedImage, or an Image loaded by the MediaTracker.

See Also:
ClusterMap

Method Detail

getImage

public java.awt.Image getImage(java.lang.Object object,
                               float selectionLevel)
Returns the Image used to render an Object contained in a Cluster.

getGraphNodeImage

public java.awt.Image getGraphNodeImage(Classification classification,
                                        float selectionLevel)
Returns the Image used to render the graph node a Classification. Note that certain Cluster Map rendering schemes may not use these icons.

getLabelImage

public java.awt.Image getLabelImage(Classification classification,
                                    float selectionLevel)
Returns the Image used in the label of the Classification. This icon will be shown in the graph in front of the Classification name.

Unlike the graph node image, the label image is always displayed by the Cluster Map, as it may contain vital semantics of the Classification that is necessary to correctly interpret the graph.

This Image may be null.
